result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:07 AM Defendant Adam J. Bicknase in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jared Redfield in court with defendant Adam J. Bicknase.
Atty Mutchler calls the case and states the appearances. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Pre-trial supervision program (not day reporting) should be condition of bond and should be amended.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:27 AM Defendant Adam J. Bicknase in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant intends to get an attorney.

Bond was previously set.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Court informs Defendant his right to a preliminary hearing.
State requests adjournment for Defendant time to seek counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Portage County Justice Programs/Referral Form

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Participate in the Portage County Day Report Program and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

1:11 PM Defendant Adam Jay Bicknase appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of 6th Offense OWI and PAC 6th.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
It is not known at today's hearing if the defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record. 

Court sets a $2,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
